body_html: Discussion with @adamlerer: if we amortize sparse updates in this way, we need some sort of "flushing" operation which a user can call to update the tensor to the "correct value" (since we may have accumulated updates on parameters that haven't been applied to the underlying tensor itself.) This is a change to the API for optimizers (a new flush function a user has to call at the end of optimizing) but since no one is actually optimizing on sparse models, this doesn't seem like a bad thing to ask them to do.
